history.content:
Usually, in a second round phone interview, you get asked coding questions, similar to those you may see on Leetcode and HackerRank. I think the best way to practice is to use those websites and do questions under actual interview conditions (e.g. time pressure). There is a mock interview option that lets you do mock phone interviews that I found particularly helpful. 

The key emphasis is not only on your coding skills but your ability to talk through your thought process with the interviewer. Practicing with a peer is a great way to prepare- I found pramp.com particularly useful because it's free, and you can do mock video interviews on a variety of topics, like data structures and system design.

Knowing your technical projects in depth is also necessary- be prepared to talk about the technical specifics of your past projects,  how you worked with a team, and the outcomes of your projects.

Hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Hi, I got a first round phone interview at a medium company by a software engineer of the company. Now the professional tech recruiter of their company want to interview me in a second round phone interview. In the first round, the engineer guy just asked me about my experience and projects, and it was obvious he's not a professional interviewer. But now since the second round of phone interview is done by a professional tech recruiter whose job is to interview tech people, I wonder what to expect in this second round of phone interview. Especially, whether there could be some technical questions.
history.subject: What to expect in a second round phone interview?
